intro: Canistrum improcerum, commonly known as the creeping fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Convulvulaceae. It is a woody vine characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. Canistrum improcerum is native to tropical regions of the Americas and is often found growing on trees or rocks in moist, shaded environments.
